channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023110123
item.description:
Report E-2023110123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was damaged in transit due to improper bracing and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor, cardboard box, and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted trailer floor and worked in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product. The impacted cardboard and all UN2922 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101299
item.description:
Report X-2023101299

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was transported to the van line on a cart. When the package handler lifted the box, it slipped out of his grip and fell to the floor. The inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle. The package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed. DescribePack: The hazmat had one of the glass liter containers break. The container had molded reconstituted paper as liners to keep the glass containers safe. However, there was 3 inches of empty space on the top of the container. This left movement for the glass containers to move around inside the fiberboard box. If the box had 1 1/2" foam on the top of the box and 1 1/2 " foam on the bottom of the box, the bottles would have been secure and safer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the inner glass cracked, then broke and leaked the acetone out of the bottle, the package handler immediately notified QA who got absorbent materials and mopped up the spilled acetone using rubber gloves and a plastic container for disposal. The box was placed inside a plastic hazmat red container and brought to the hazmat cage for the HESS report to be completed.

item.title: Report X-2023101051
item.description:
Report X-2023101051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A metal drum which is dented pretty badly, has an opening around the lid/metal seals. The lid is also dented upwards in one spot. DescribePack: The lid failed due to it being dented, leaving an opening on the end of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was put in a red hazmat bucket and brought over to our hazmat cage, put on the fumes hud with the fan on.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found this hazmat near the local QA table, it was wet because of it having a loose cap. So I took it over to our QA hazmat cage to processes it. DescribePack: It was a corrosive jug with a loose cap and caused it to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was in a red hazmat bin in locals area, so I carried it over to our hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager opened the door to the trailer the package was on and it immediately fell to the floor, cap broke off inside the package and leaked contents. It was immediately cleaned and brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles popped off when the package fell. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a damage bin and brought to hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found on load side wet and leaking from lid. package handler handling product got some of the product on themselves. upon discovery package was placed in hazmat bagged lined tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection/ processing. DescribePack: lid was loose/ possibly bad seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: upon discovery package was placed in hazmat bagged lined tote and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection/ processing.

item.title: Report X-2023100676
item.description:
Report X-2023100676

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During preload a package handler was unloading a trailer when he noticed the box was wet along the side. He informed his manager which contacted the hazmat team to inspect the box. After placing in a yellow hazmat drum to be processed inside the hazmat cage under ventilation. It was discovered that the caps were loose on 2 of the bottles. DescribePack: 2 caps were loose on the degreaser causing them to spill inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the box was placed in a yellow hazmat drum and placed under ventilation in the hazmat cage.
